section.title: Authentication
section.para: &api_name; uses HTTP Basic authentication for all requests. The following example shows how this is done with the CURL command line HTTP client.
HTTP Basic authentication is sent as an Authorization header in each HTTP request. The header should contain a base64-encoded string in the form username:password, as shown in the example below.
Because HTTP Basic sends your login credentials with every request encoded in base64 format, &api_name; requires HTTPS connections for security.

section.programlisting: GET /&api_version;/profiles HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ=
